planets.name: Mercury
planets.fact: Mercury has the most craters in the Solar System. A day on Mercury takes 59 Earth days.

planets.name: Venus
planets.fact: Venus is the second brightest natural object in the night sky after the Moon. One rotation on venus is equal to 243 earth days.

planets.name: Earth
planets.fact: Earth's core Is as hot as the Sun's surface. The planet is 10,000 times older than humans.

planets.name: Mars
planets.fact: Mars has a weaker gravity than Earth. A day on Mars is 24.6 hours.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.fact: Jupiter is more than twice as massive as all the other planets combined. Jupiter's stripes and swirls are actually cold, windy clouds of ammonia and water in an atmosphere of hydrogen and helium.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.fact: Uranus is surrounded by a set of 13 rings. Uranus spins the opposite direction as Earth and most other planets.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.fact: Neptune is about four times wider than Earth. Neptune has 14 moons.

planets.name: Dwarf Planet : Pluto
planets.fact: Pluto is smaller than the Moon.  Pluto got its name from 11-year-old Venetia Burney.
